meanings.definition: (of a horse) to run fast with a two-beat stride in which all four legs are off the ground at once
meanings.sent1: The horse galloped across the field.
meanings.sent2: The stallion galloped gracefully in the meadow.
meanings.sent3: The pony galloped so fast, it almost looked like it was flying!
meanings.sent4: Her heart galloped with excitement as she approached the finish line.
meanings.sent5: The sound of hooves galloping echoed through the valley.

meanings.definition: to move or progress quickly and energetically
meanings.sent1: The children galloped down the street to catch the ice cream truck.
meanings.sent2: Time galloped by as they enjoyed each other's company.
meanings.sent3: The puppy galloped around the yard, full of playful energy.
meanings.sent4: Laughter galloped through the room, contagious and joyful.
meanings.sent5: The river galloped over the rocks, rushing towards the waterfall.
